title: Carer raped grandmother, 83, in her bed after wheeling disabled husband out of room
text:

A grandmother-of-eight was raped by an in-house carer who was supposed to be helping her disabled husband.

The rapist, Simon Prodanovich, 59, carried out the horrifying attack on the 83-year-old woman after wheeling her husband out of the bedroom.

He initially accused the elderly woman of lying for revenge but confessed after DNA findings revealed the truth.

He pleaded guilty to rape in the County Court of Victoria, reports Daily Mail Australia.

Prodanovich, from Springvale, Melbourne, had been in the aged-care business for a little more than a year and worked for home care company Omni-Care.

He attacked the victim while he was at her home caring for her husband - who has a number of illnesses and uses a wheelchair.

(Image: Burton Mail)

The couple had been married for more than 60 years and had been living in their home for most of their time together.

The victim had been her husband's carer and the pair had been reluctant to allow carers into their home but gave in to their daughter's wishes as they did not want to move into a specialised home.

On January 12, Prodanovich entered the couple's home and gave his victim's husband a sponge bath.

He then offered the mother-of-three a massage after she mentioned she needed her medications to help with her legs.

(Image: Getty Images/iStockphoto)

After taking her husband into the lounge room, Prodanovich began massaging the woman in the bedroom.

Prodanovich then licked his fingers and raped the woman as she begged him to stop.

He fled after the attack.

When questioned days later, he denied raping his victim and accused her of lying in revenge for him refusing to rub lotion on her.

But the carer admitted his crimes after analysis of DNA he had left on his victim revealed he had raped her.

In a statement read out by the victim's daughters in court, the 83-year-old said she now fears all men and did not feel safe with any male nurse, doctor or taxi driver.

"I remember what happened and sometimes cry," the statement read.

The woman's daughters told the court their mum had been strong, sociable and independent before the attack and had taken a leap of faith in accepting carers into her home.

Her husband has been placed in respite care as she struggles to care for him.

Defence lawyers Ian Crisp said Prodanovich was "ashamed and sorrowful" for what he did.

He argued his client's attack had been unplanned and opportunistic, a "spur of the moment" attack.

But Judge Susan Pullen pointed out that Prodanovich had taken his victim's husband out of the room and licked his fingers.

Prodanovich has been remanded in custody and will be sentenced on Thursday.
description: Simon Prodanovich, from Melbourne, worked for home care company Omni-Care when he carried out the brutal sex attack
